text: Epstein-Barr virus ( EBV ) infects B cells , resulting in the outgrowth of immortalised lymphoblastoid cell lines ( LCLs ) .

Here , we demonstrate through the use of intracellular staining that <extra_id_0> interleukin-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is expressed in LCLs and investigate the influence of the individual latent proteins on the expression of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Using RT-PCR , <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was shown to be up-regulated in EBV-transformed LCLs as well as in group III Burkitt 's lymphoma ( BL ) cell lines , compared with group I BL cell lines .

The up-regulation of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> message could be mediated by the <extra_id_0> latent membrane protein-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> EBV nuclear proteins 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> 4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> 6 genes <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Electrophoretic mobility shift assays ( EMSAs ) demonstrated that the -300 region of the <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , which contains a nuclear factor-kappaB ( NF-kappaB ) binding site , contained a functional RBP binding site .

Binding of RBP to this site could be inhibited by addition of <extra_id_0> EBV nuclear proteins 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> 6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , suggesting that these proteins displace RBP from its recognition sequence , removing transcriptional repression and allowing gene transcription to occur .

In group I BL cells , containing low levels of NF-kappaB , only RBP binding was observed in EMSAs , whereas NF-kappaB binding could be demonstrated in EBV-transformed B cell lines containing high levels of activated NF-kappaB .

In addition , the expression of <extra_id_0> latent membrane protein-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> led to activation of NF-kappaB that was capable of binding the <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .
